amendment.description: Amendment reduces by $1 billion the amount authorized for State water pollution control revolving funds over the next five years; and eliminates State nonpoint source water pollution control revolving funds.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 64 in the Congressional Record of May 11) to reduce the authorization in the bill for state water pollution control revolving funds by $200 million in each FY 1997-2000, and to eliminate the $500 million authorization in the bill for the State nonpoint source water pollution control revolving fund.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Largent amendment (A025) Agreed to by recorded vote: 209 - 192 (Roll no. 329).
